org.mfg.mdb.compiler

Interface ICompilerExtension

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IExtensionTargets

    public interface ICompilerExtension
extends IExtensionTargets

    This is the interface to extend the MDB compiler. A compiler extension is not more than the opportunity a developer has to generate part of the MDB classes to implement certain user-domain patterns. Probably this is something you will never use and really it was created to implement certain MFG-related solutions that we decided keep outside MDB, like a CSV import/export feature.

    An extension is formed by a target and an emitter. A target refers to a point in the generated code. There are defined only 3:

    • IExtensionTargets.TARGET_MDB_CLASS: Use this to inject code in the body of an MDB class.
    • IExtensionTargets.TARGET_MDB_CLASS_APPEND_METHOD: Use this to inject code at the end of the append() method of an MDB class.
    • IExtensionTargets.TARGET_SESSION_CLASS: Use this to inject code in the body of the MDBSession class.

    The following class is an example of extension that print each record is added to any MDB file: 

      class PrintAddedRecordExtension implements ICompilerExtension {
        public String getTarget() {
                return TARGET_MDB_CLASS_APPEND_METHOD;
        }
  
 TODO:missing real example. 
  }

    To register a compiler extension use the method Compiler.extension(ICompilerExtension) in the schema definition "script". To run an extension in an MyA template, use the OpenPrinter.emitExt(String, Table) method.

    Author:
    arian
    See Also:
    OpenPrinter, MyA

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.mfg.mdb.compiler.IExtensionTargets

        TARGET_MDB_CLASS, TARGET_MDB_CLASS_APPEND_METHOD, TARGET_SESSION_CLASS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String executeExtension(java.io.InputStream replacedFile, Table table)
      Execute the extension.
      java.lang.String getTarget()
      Get the target of the extension.

    • Method Detail

      • getTarget

        java.lang.String getTarget()
        Get the target of the extension. Use one of the constants defined in IExtensionTargets.
        Returns:
        The extension target.

      • executeExtension

        java.lang.String executeExtension(java.io.InputStream replacedFile,
                                  Table table)
        Execute the extension. It returns the text to be injected in the caller.
        Parameters:
        replacedFile - The input stream of the file is replacing. This can be useful if the emitter needs to know the content of the file it is replacing.
        table - The table definition associated with the code it is generating, however to get access to all the table definitions the user can use the Table.getSchema() method.
        Returns:
        The extension emitter.
